review_body: My fourth time here at my New York home, always such a lovely welcome from door men and reception who instantly welcome you back like an old friend. Although I always arrive early the nearly always have my room ready for me and if not I am sat down with a drink in the cosy lounge and wait for a matter of minutes. Always upgrade me to a lovely large room where I can both work, sleep and chill out in. Started having breakfast downstairs instead of my room! They always find me a little table tucked away so I can read and people watch! And yes as a staunch Englishman from the north they always bring me brown sauce (if you know you know!) Had planned to of been there twice already but current issues prevented me! However I will be back for at least another six times in 2020 and I can't wait.

We stayed here for 3 nights and loved the hotel. The F/O team and concierges were very helpful and accommodating, the gym was nice but small, it did have all the necessary equipment for a good work-out though. We never actually tried the restaurant other than some bar snacks and breakfast but what we did have was good. The bar seems very popular with locals and was always busy, however, the Maitre'd was always accommodating to hotel guests which was well appreciated.

Best hotel in midtown- location, service, amenities are ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️spectacular! Location is 2 blocks Fromm Central Park, a few blocks to a show and steps form the best shopping. The service is impeccable and friendly. The staff welcome you upong every return and it feels as if you are coming home from a visit. I would request an interior room- and it will be the quietest room in Manhattan. Rooms are beautifully decorated by Kit Kemp.

The staff is world-class, the decor is stunning, the accommodations are luxurious. The room is absolutely spotlessly clean and beautifully designed with plenty of space. Amazing facilities in the room that I stayed and the environment here was exquisite which made my day.

Stayed for 2 nights for work. Perfect location being a walk away from all meetings, shops and Central Park. Food is delicious and staff are charming. Rooms are really beautifully done up and spacious which is a rarity for New York. I will be staying again on my next trip, thank you.

Ate at restaurant didn't stay at hotel. The lobby of hotel has interesting art work. Dinner was delicious, great service and a stunning and eclectic atmosphere. Interesting. Would defiantly return.Loud and rocking bar but dining was more civilized.

Another lovely stay at my second home in New York. Nice welcome and a cute little gift with a personalised note in my room, I love it when hotels recognise you like this. All staff were great, as usual. Dark haired lady behind the bar at night and the long haired chap who delivered room service in the morning deserve a mention. Breakfast staff were all so friendly and nothing to much trouble. Room was bright, large and spotlessly clean and the bed, as ever was big and comfortable. My only issue, everyday I ordered room service items were missing, basic things like cups, tea strainer and even items of food and drink, was irritating having to call back down and wait another 15 minutes, especially based on the cost and tray charge. If you could fix that you’d be perfect in every way. Saying that... I’m booked to see you again in April.

We did a quick trip to NYC, just a couple of nights, and we tried a smaller property. The Whitby delivered at every turn. Concierge, front desk, bellmen—all helpful, pleasant, and professional. The location in midtown is great and within walking distance of numerous sights and attractions. The room was well-appointed, comfortable, and impeccable. Book here without hesitation.

We were staying in NYNY over Christmas / New Year and were told of the Whitby. We tried it out for drinks and dinner. What a great hotel. It has great staff, a stunning decor and an entertaining grand father clock.I highly recommend

I’ll start by saying that you get what you pay for and in this case - it’s a lot. A lot of stunning interior decorating, eclectic and unique artwork, outstanding service, and unrivaled comfort. Believe it or not, I could not hear the midtown traffic from the bedroom (although in fairness, I was a bit distracted by the stunning details I was paying my attention to). We originally had a standard suite but was upgraded to the executive suite. (For the Americans reading this - it rivaled any exceptional Million Dollar Listing: New York property - I felt like a star!) Multiple bedrooms, bathrooms, even living rooms! Little touches such as heated marble bathroom floors (a must during winters in the NE), marble walls, stainless steel appliances, really added to the notion that we weren’t just at any luxury hotel. Each room in the entire hotel - from the restaurant and bar to the foyers outside the elevator bays - held unique art. Even the walls throughout the hotel had padded fabrics on them. It was as if Kit Kemp herself walked every inch of the building and personally designed it with her own eyes. Who knows, perhaps she did. And it’s outstanding. Let’s not discount the staff - gorgeous, friendly (but not stiff or sterile like other luxury hotel staff can be sometimes), vibrant and gracious.The entire experience was one of a kind and I cannot recommend it enough.

We had an incredible experience at the Whitby hotel! From the service to the interior design and layout of our suite, everything was impeccable, inviting and top-notch. We loved the food in the restaurant, the Paloma cocktails and delicious breakfast. The location is perfect too! We can’t wait to come back. We give this hotel our highest recommendation! ❤️

I lived in NYC for 10 years and really loved it, but whenever I return on business, I typically dread my hotel stays because the rooms are usually really loud or deliver a disappointing experience. This is not the case at all with the Whitby Hotel. The service is outstanding (especially Autumn at reception), the food is delicious, the bed is very comfortable, the decor is lovely, and the room was quiet.

review_body: Could not love this hotel more, everything about the experience here is first class from start to finish. Amazing team members across the board who go out of their way to provide exceptional service, beautiful rooms where form meets functionality in every way, great food in the restaurant and a buzzing bar with great cocktails - all in a great location close to Central Park and 5th Ave retail.

My wife and I decided on a trip to NYC for the labor day weekend. We wanted to stay at a nice hotel near Central Park and after researching multiple options we decided on The Whitby Hotel. It was definitely the right choice!The only difficult part was finding the hotel. We drove past it the first time and and to circle back around. The entrance is rather unassuming and there is construction (of course there is in NYC) going on across the street. The staff is extremely helpful with your luggage and valet of your vehicle. Check-in was quick and easy. We stayed in a Junior Suite, which was perfect. The room was on the 6th floor with a street view (nothing to see here but the construction across the street). You're not really going to get views in this hotel, but that wasn't a big deal. I'd rather go walk around the city to get the views. The room is a good size. The bathroom has a soaking tub, a TV mounted in the wall by the tub, some automatic lights (helpful at night), a toilet, two sinks and a shower. The hotel is stylish in a very cool way with a mix of contemporary and traditional decor. The beds were comfortable and the room was surprisingly quiet. The Whitby bar/restaurant is great as well. Healthy breakfast options and great service. The gym was also a nice surprise. We were expecting very limited equipment and for a boutique hotel it was very good. You can definitely do strength training and cardio with what they have to offer. Overall, a great stay and we will be back. Kudos to the staff -- all very helpful and pleasant. Thanks for a great stay!

We were strolling down 5th, heading to Saks when we spotted this little gem. I’m not sure what it was that made me peer inside the window of The Whitby Bar, but I’m so glad I did! Immediately I told my friend, we are going inside to take a look. The decor is what lured me in! It was like an eclectic look between Europe and New Orleans. I later found out the interior is designed by the owner Kit Kemp who is know for her stylish and witty interiors. Exactly! We asked for a little tour of the restaurant and saw a few young women having a tea party in back! The seating is all sofas and soft cushy chairs. We asked to see the dinner menu and canceled our reservations at Stk for dinner and booked a reservation here! We arrived full of excitement! The service was impeccable! The host Mr. Hunter sent over two glasses of champagne to help us celebrate my Birthday! Nice touch! Our waiter Carlos was a gem! He was polite! Offered suggestions when asked, came to the table at the exact perfect moments to ask if we needed anything. The food was spectacular! We both had the burrata salad, so fresh and the balsamic vinegar was def of high quality! The bread, the butter, the water, the presentation was superb! For dinner we both had the NY Beef Filet... best I’ve had at any high end steak house! For dessert they send over a beautiful cupcake with a candle in it for my Birthday! That cupcake was amazing! We also ordered the blueberry pie with a dollop of ice cream and the best cafe latte I’ve ever had except for when I was in Cuba! After dinner we asked for a tour of the hotel! They had a beautiful library themed space for parties, a theater with red leather seats!! The bathrooms were something out of an Alice and Wonderland storybook! I asked to see the rooms but they were fully booked! I will one day spend a night at this hotel! No doubt about it!

Luxury boutique hotel, the right place to spend your time in NY. I have appreciated the kindeness of all the people, the concierge facilities and the dettailed modern and warm Tim & Kit Kemp style. Don't forget to try the cocktail bar and restaurant.Thanks for your attention to me and my family. I surely suggest the Whitby to people looking for high quality boutique hotels.

We stayed at The Whitby at the beginning and also end of our USA trip in late July and early August this year. What a location and what a hotel!It’s hard to know where to start with a review, as there are so many positives to mention!From the moment you arrive kerbside you are met by a friendly and helpful member of staff, and from that point onwards, every person you interact with is fantastic. Stewart, Holly, Tess and Katie are just a few of the brilliant managers, and Kathrin the General Manager took time herself to come and chat with us. The entire team really made our stay!The quality of design and decor are incredible, and it is worth spending some time to look at the detail of the many fabrics, finishes and art throughout.The rooms are the best that we have found yet, with more than you would expect from most other five star hotels. Every room is unique, but nicely similar in terms of key features. We noted that the furniture fabrics and other details were different in in each, but the rooms share a very relaxing and comfortable feel.The bathroom suite and finishes are superb, with Kit Kemp (the Owner’s) own brand of shampoo and moisturiser.The bar and restaurant are perfectly sized for the hotel, and the atmosphere tends to be really nice, with a mix of residents and business people in at breakfast and dinner times. The bar looks great, and has a fantastic offering, and the food and service levels absolutely exceptional. The breakfast service is marvellous.Alongside the amazing and unique level of attention to detail in respect of the finishes, the staff team and location make this the only hotel option for us when we return to New York.

My wife and I stayed at the Whitby on the leisure/business trip to NYC and initially chose the hotel for its design and location. Having stayed for almost a week, it has by far been one of THE BEST hotel stays we ever had! Where to start... It began with the simple and highly personalized reservation process, where the reception guided us on room/suite options and the ideal set up for us. Upon arrival, we were greeted by name (throughout the stay by every team member) and were touched by the many details at the hotel...the art, the design, the amenities, the generous fruit basket and water in the room, the personalized and handwritten card by General Manager Kathrin and sooo much more!The views on 56th street are wonderful and the floor to ceiling windows make it even more inspiring and give it a great urban feel. We do live in Dubai, so feeling NYC and its energy 24/7 whilst being in NYC was amazing! We also liked the gym a lot with its top state of the art equipment, the very high res screens with business news on and the muesli bars. Talking food and snack, breakfast ist phenomenal and my personal favorite was the avo toast and the fresh berries and bircher muesli :) Another "hidden gem" is the hotel"s "honesty bar", a library style like lounge in top privacy and comfort, to enjoy a drink or coffee, doing emails and/or focus work or read. Another highlight of our stay was a) the amazing concierge team who helped us out with our daily excursions and restaurant arrangements and the very hands on- and always present General Manager Ms Kathrin, who even offered us a house tour.In brief, a very wonderful stay, super amazing team, great location - VERY WELL DONE everyone and we will be back soon!

When you travel all over the world and stay in a variety of hotels, it’s nice to know that when you book a 5* one, it truly is! The Whitby is exceptional from entrance to exit. I was actually lucky enough to be upgraded to a luxury room, which was superb, large, floor to ceiling windows and so comfortable, I didn’t want to leave! The bed was a dream to sleep on. Staff are super friendly, especially the room service team and nothing too much trouble. It was the little extras I loved. The lavender linen spray to help you sleep and the eye cream amenity. This is everything any other New York hotel isn’t. I want to go back right now!

Bottom line….this is a special hotel on a world scale and the very best that NYC has to offer a discerning traveler. The property is a perfect example of a hotel done right and is a complete delight to experience, beginning with quality construction and décor in every aspect, plus an environment that pleases the senses from all angles, and is so comfortable and welcoming as to be measured “a ten on the ten scale”. The amenities are simply superb, from the well-used honour bar to the +100 Mbps room internet to that marvellous grandfather clock in the lobby, and “the OMG showers”! The rooms are completely suitable in all respects and especially so when compared to competing choices. The kitchen produces a very respectable product in all regards…“all the basics done very well” and it is a rare and valuable thing to experience in the course of leisure travel. All that said, it is the human element that rockets The Whitby to the top. An exceptional team in all roles, with a visible engagement and commitment to guest satisfaction and simply a joy to experience.

This hotel is a must stay when visiting NYC. The rooms are very spacious, clean, and comfortable. The bathrooms are beautiful. The windows are big and beautiful. I highly highly recommend this hotel. The Service was honestly the best service I have ever received at a hotel. The staff were incredible. It was well worth the money. Great location. I honestly cannot say enough amazing things about this hotel. We LOVED it.

My family had 5 nights here in January. We were already fans of Kit Kemp having stayed in a number of her London hotels. This met our high expectations of unique design and good service. Our only minor quibbles were the lack of a both tub, the outlook from ur tooms which was onto another building, and the breakfast which was not up to the standard of the Hamyard in London. But the rooms were excellent, the public areas unique. Alos the location is very handy for the tourist sites.

My wife and I spent a four night stay over the 4th of July weekend. Everything about this hotel is perfect. Physically the hotel is beautiful and all the furnishings are of the highest quality imaginable. We stayed in a junior suite which had two sitting areas a work desk and ample, well-designed closet space. The totally marble bath was immense and had a huge, deep soaking tub, a spacious shower, double sinks and a heated towel rack. Color schemes are comforting and cleverly thought out. Our view to the street was through floor to ceiling windows that spanned the full width of the room. The restaurant (wonderful full breakfast and bar (try the raspberry champagne side car) are great and breakfast is terrific. Service is perfect and all the servers won our hearts. We also loved the "residents only lounge," with its own honor bar. You may serve yourself ready made cocktails to serve over ice or make your own cocktail from a full range of liquors and mixers. Amazing. The entire hotel is quiet and dignified, with excellent sound proofing and a clientele that is classy and always appropriate, What a place!!!!!!

The hotel is beautiful and makes you feel like you are in Europe. The decor is so pretty and well designed to add a special ambiance. The food is amazingly delicious. What a wonderful place to have a wedding. What a gem..

The restaurant in the Whitby is excellent. The food is well prepared, interesting and the service superb. Start with a glass of champagne and the evening will be magical. I would be remiss if I did not mention the absolute beauty of the dining room. The platters that decorate the walls are amazing. It is definitely worth a visit the next time you are in mid-town.

I am thrilled to say, that I had the ultimate hotel experience, while staying at The Whitby Hotel. Since it was my Anniversary, I wanted to surprise my other half with a rare and unique property, in the heart of Manhattan!! From the moment we entered the hotel until our departure, we were treated like royalty,by the warm and accommodating staff, who just couldn’t do enough for us! Thank You to Janelle, Brian, and Christopher at the front desk, and to West, Jamal, Freddie, and Michael who catered to our every request, during our stay! Our special Anniversary visit was filled with many pleasant surprises, during our stay. Especially the much appreciated surprise of the amazing room upgrade! Champagne, with a personally written note from the general manager, and a lovely gift for us to take home with us.  The property itself was overwhelmingly amazing, with whimsical object d’art, paintings, and amazing fabrics filling every space we entered. The bar and restaurant was charming and inviting. We spent as much time as possible enjoying the space. Breakfast was incredibly delicious, and Moses and Alfredo made sure were well attended to! Not to mention the most perfect Cappuccino! The entire staff was extremely charming, friendly, and highly professional.  In essence, as a seasoned professional in the service industry for over 20 years, I have never been more impressed and overjoyed, by a hotel’s staff as a whole, and the Firmdale Hotel Brand. As well as the joyful and uplifting interior designs, by the amazing Kit Kemp!

Staying at The Whitby for a family visit was pure pleasure. Our junior terrace suite was one of the nicer rooms we've stayed in of late. While the hotel's location in the middle of the block of 56th between 5th and 6th Avenues is unremarkable, the peaceful view from the café table on our 15th-floor corner terrace made us feel as though we were the only people around. The floor-to-ceiling windows made our smallish suite feel spacious. The bed was extremely comfortable and the walk-in closet was possibly the largest we have seen in Manhattan. We enjoyed the whimsical colorful artworks displayed throughout the hotel as well as the clusters of straw baskets hanging above the sunny bar. Drinks and snacks at the bar were very tasty and service was pleasant and friendly. All of the staff members were warm and helpful. In sum, we enjoyed everything about our stay here and would highly recommend it.

We stayed for 6 nights. Very good location. The interior design, choice of surface materials is fabulous, exciting, funny and interesting. The room has a fantastic headboard and the bathroom is really comfortable with a big shower. Really nice breakfast menu during the week sometimes too busy with business meetings. Be careful when you ask the concierge for activities. We reserved a bike ride over Brooklyn bridges. which was confirmed for 10am 4th June by Brooklyn Giro Bicycle Tours. Arrived at the meeting point in Brooklyn after a 45 min Uber ride...The meeting point was in a storage warehouse in on of Brooklyn most broken neighbourhoods. Inside the storage warehouse finally we found a door with a sticker on for the bicycle company. But door was padlocked no one there....Called the concierge after some time he answered that they had received a change of time for the the bike trip it was now going to depart 12 am. We could not wait there for 2 hours due to other commitments so another Uber ride 45 min back.

I have always been a fan of the Firmdale Hotels and I finally got the chance to stay in one.I arrived early in the morning and got an early check-in with an upgrade to junior suite.The lobby and restaurant were amazing, full of colors and details. A combination of classic British design with the modern colorful touch.The room was stunning, very clean and full of details. Each room in the hotel has its own design but you can tell they have the same spirit, especially with the signature mannequin in each.The bed was extremely comfortable.I asked for a steaming iron and a coffee machine and got what I needed in no time.The hotel manager sent a personalized welcome note with a small gift.The receptionist and concierge were so helpful and kind, I was able to plan my schedule efficiently to cover most of the places I had in mind because of their advice.The location was so convenient a couple of minutes walk to 5th Avenue and close to most of the attractions - walking distance.The price was a bit high but worth it.

The hotel is perfectly situated in NYC close to any touristic or professional main location. The staff was so helpful, warm and professional. The room with terrasse is a must, specially with a sunny morning, to enjoy a breakfast on it. The room a perfectly decorated every details has been thought to make you stay perfect. The room is very well isolated. The perfect luxury hotel. Thanks again for the amazing stay to the staff there.

This hotel is so lovely. The staff were very friendly and accommodating. The rooms are beautiful, small but beautiful. The decor of the hotel is stunning. Loved my stay here and would definitely come again

Fantastic afternoon tea. Where else do you get pure Irish linen tablecloths, Irish linen napkins, English bone china and silverplate (instead of stainless steel) flatware?Great tea sandwiches, delicious scones and tea cakes. Fragrant loose leaf tea and attentive service in a beautiful room.This is by far the best English afternoon tea in NY.

The rooms are very cozy, super clean and the service is great. If I had to be super picky the service in the restaurant is slow. The bathrooms are spacious, the sheets and towels are super soft. Highly recommend.

This is one of the most remarkable hotels I have stayed in for work in NY. It’s a lovely boutique hotel fromThe quaint lobby with the fun grandfather clock to fun art in the elevator. BUT the rooms are bigger than any regular hotel in NY. The bathroom was is super modern. Mine had dual sinks. A walk in shower and a bathtub with a TV in the wall. It also had towel heaters! Nice touch. The service in the hotel was exceptional and the staff was kind and accommodating. I would stay here again and again!

Fabulous. Was a great visit, delicious food, lovely staff, the decor and art is amazing. Highly recommend to anyone who is visiting New York and wants a beautiful boutique hotel. The location is also great, though some of the rooms are slightly small and look out to a wall.

My Aunt and I just spent 5 wonderful days at the whitby. My daughter joined us for 2 of the days as well. I have no complaints what so ever. The hotel is beautiful, spotless and it feels like home away from home. Every staff we came across in reception, the doormen, the waiters concierge and so on were all super lovely. They all seemed genuinely interested in our family and made us feel welcome. I was nervous about the location being so close to trump tower, however, there were no issues. I usually stay downtown at their sister hotel The Crosby, but we were pleasantly surprised at how convenient this location was. There is a lot of shopping and great places to eat on your doorstep. We stayed in a junior suite which is very spacious with a walk-in closet and huge room and bathroom with tub and bidet! For us this was a special treat, it will be hard to go back to regular room next time. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Our stay at the Whitby Hotel was supurb. It was an easy walk to our several plays. The rooms are fantastic and clean, the food , bar, and service are all to notch. Even the hotel manager greets guests.

My very short stay in Whitby Hotel was more than perfect! The location, sophisticated decoration, staff, service... everything was excellent.I had a huge room with a big terrace.It is going to be my no 1 adress in Nyc.

Inside the boutique Whitby Hotel in Midtown West, just West if 5th Avenue on 56th Street is the quirky, exotic and AMAZING Whitby Hotel Restaurant. wonderful atmosphere, decor, service and food. Quiet, sophisticated, exotic and touch of Britain. HIGHY RECOMMENDED

This is a small but beautifully formed hotel in an exceptional location. The rooms were spacious and tastefully decorated, we had a suite with terrace which was stunning, although below freezing so we didn't utilize it. The bar is great fun and busy with a jazz band. The Kemps have a quintessentially English touch with great taste. Wonderful stay.

The hotel is in a super location. 5/10 mins from so many great spots - Central Park, Rockefeller Centre, Times Square, MoMA, shops etc!! The staff were great and the hotel is beautifully decorated. However (and I appreciate this could be personal preference), only the suites had baths?! As an English person used to baths in most English and European hotels, particularly the ‘nicer’ ones, I was so disappointed that our room didn’t have a bath and we could only get one if we upgraded to a suite (if one was available and there wasn’t). I’m sorry but for the price I would expect a shower and a bath and I won’t be staying again for that sole reason. The shower was super but it’s not the same...

We enjoyed a four night stay with our adult family taking 3 rooms. We’d previously stayed at a couple of the groups’ London hotels and really enjoyed the comfort, service and ambience there. The Whitby didn’t disappoint. The rooms were beautiful furnished, comfortable and finished to a very high standard. The staff were welcoming and helpful. The drawing room, bar, dining room, library etc a haven from the busy streets of the city and the location worked well for all of us.Only point of contention.... we a paid 30% deposit when the booking was made and the balance of $6,000 on arrival for the rooms.... it was a slight shock when a further $14,000 was pre-authorised on the Amex for extras!

This hotel is absolutely adorable! The rooms are large and clean. When most hotels put a mint on your pillow, these folks step up the game - you get eye creme and linen spritz! The bathrooms have double sinks, towel warmers, a nice big shower with a shower head that makes you feel like you went a round with Tyson. There's also a bidet! The really large window with ledge, writing desks and the whole French country styling - complete with framed quilts on the walls are a sweet touch. Don't forget to go to the bar and partake in tea time. I had called down to make a reservation at the last minute and was told they were booked up, but I did tell the folks at reservation my hotel room. With in minutes, I get a call from the head of concierge, noting that they take take of folks in the hotel firstly - so table booked. Now, room service - good, but needs work. Food arrived cold, but they did replace it. This hotel would benefit from hot boxes that are used in most hotels. And, location. You're a block from the best shopping in the world. Also, most Uber drivers and cabbies do not know that this hotel exists. Even New Yorkers are taken aback. This hotel is rather new - it just turned two. The rooms are also soundproof. All, in all, this is my new NYC destination spot. PS - don't forget about the movie theater in the basement. Ya'll - that took the cake.

Stayed at the Whitby hotel this weekend. A mix of business & family. A fantastic experience. Great location, great staff, wonderful service. Rooms are so perfect you don’t even feel like you are staying in a hotel. Highly recommend. Our new go to NYC hotel.

The Whitby...another beautifully appointed hotel by the incredible Kit Kemp.What feast for the eyes!!The interiors at The Whitby are nothing short of fabulous. From the English/Irish baskets hanging over the bar, the Sunday Roast trays in perspex boxes in the dining room and the linen lined walls just add to the warmth and character that is Firmdale.The staff are simply incredible.The concierge team...Todd, Frederick and Danny...their knowledge of all things Midtown New York made our stay stress free and unforgettable. Nothing was too much. The front desk always had a warm welcome and smile to greet you after a long day sightseeing.I'd highly recommend staying here...it was like staying in some one's home.

We stumbled on this property by accident so glad we did. This is a hidden gem!!!Very trendy yet not obnoxious. For starters, the location is amazing. Close to everything!!! While getting a local feel. The bar/ restaurant as soon as you enter is very inviting. Even if not staying there worth stopping by for the decor. Drinks are good with NYC prices to match.They even offer dinner and a movie which seem like a real deal. Sadly, we missed it.The common areas are inviting. I especially enjoyed the library room. It truly beckons to curl up with a book while sipping a brandy. (Honor system) Front office and concierge profesional, helpful and approachable. They give you actual keys to your room. Love the security. The elevator only moves with the swipe of your key.The room. Oh the room. We had a terrace suite with lounge chairs and a dining table to dine al fresco when it’s not 33 degrees outside. The decor was clean yet chic. The bedroom spacious. Excellent nights sleep.The en suite bathroom luxurious. Double vanity, deep soaking tub, separate spacious shower, and heated towels!!!Not to mention the tv in the bathroom. Fresh flowers in the living room and bathroom. Very nice touch. I really appreciated the attention to detail. I say that within a year Condé Nast will recognize this property. Look forward to our return.PS - room service food is delicious and they arrive when promised.

The hotel is fantastically located, Central Park is close as is 5th and 6th Avenues.What a gem of a place to stay, great staff, very comfortable rooms and a decent bar and restaurant The staff were always engaging and friendly, the concierge particularly paid close attention to guests needs.Having been to NewYork a number of times this hotel is up there with the bestWill definitely go again

Stayed here for a whole week and thoroughly enjoyed the hotel. The Whitby is very boutique and there's lot of individuality and uniqueness about the decor. Their housekeeping team is first class and if you are a fan of spotlessly clean bathrooms, regular towel changes and crisp white bed linen this place is definitely for you. The Firmdale Group have brought all of their expertise from London to New York via this beautiful asset.I was particularly impressed by the quality of the breakfast and thoroughly enjoyed the very cool atmosphere and decor of the bar and restaurant. I would instantly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants the best in boutique hotel experiences.

My daughter and I recently spent three nights at this lovely hotel. The service is impeccable and everyone is friendly/helpful. The location of this hotel was perfect in that we were able to walk everywhere-to Broadway shows, stores, great restaurants, Rockefeller Center, etc. We had a delicious tea at the Whitby. The scones were excellent, as good if not better than scones we’ve had in England. Splitting a “tea” was the right amount of food for the two of us. Our room was beautifully decorated and was sound proof. The beds were super comfortable and had been separated into a pair of twins as requested. There are many extra details in the room and bathroom to ensure guests are as comfortable as possible. I would highly recommend this hotel and look forward to trying Firmdale hotels in London in the future.

Returned back to the Whitby, and we were so glad we returned. Every morning Leo greeted us by name at breakfast with superb service. The breakfast is fresh and delicious, with lots of healthy options and decadent treats. The decor is quite mind blowing. This hotel has the same aesthetic as all the Firmdale hotels making the guests feel cosy and at home. The beds are so comfortable and the bathrooms well appointed. Every part of the hotel is gorgeous clean and a visual feast. The concierge service is next level. Special mention to Todd and Frederick - there is nothing these guys cannot achieve to please their guests and make our requests into reality. From theatre tickets to restaurant bookings to VIP private tours at art galleries, museums and general directions, these guys are the very best! We can’t wait to return

We checked in to this Boutique hotel with high expectations and it didn’t disappoint. Great location, impeccable attention to detail and the rooms are to die for!! We spent three nights here and the first two mornings we slept to 11... they are so quiet.. couldn’t hear any hallway noise, felt like sleeping in your own home!!

Ok, the Whitby is expensive — in fact, very expensive. But if you’re looking for a centrally located hotel that makes you feel at home away from home, this is it. I had a cozy and clean room at the back, which meant no view, but absolutely no noise either. Beautiful, super comfortable bed, spacious bathroom with a large shower that worked impeccably (no need to fumble with various knobs just to be splashed with either cold or boiling hot water), super quiet A/C, large closet with plenty of hangers — everything you need in a hectic city that never sleeps. The concierge and the doormen were extremely friendly and helpful (thank you, Todd and staff!), which also helped made me feel comfortable and at home. The street has various restaurants, nail salons, small grocery shops, delis, hair salons etc., so you are only a few steps away from most of the things you might need, while the 5th Avenue designer shops are just round the corner. The subway station on 57th street is currently under renovation, so you have to walk a few more blocks to get on the subway. Also, since Trump Tower is just round the corner, the whole street might be barricaded when the President is in the city.The restaurant, however, is a different matter. Although beautifully and creatively decorated and absolutely inviting, it left much to be desired. If you ask for a glass of sparkling water, you get a liter bottle for eight dollars (even when you eat a tiny continental breakfast for $25 consisting of a minuscule quantity of butter, one kind of jam and two slices of toast plus a bit of yoghurt, fruit and nuts - the müsli and berries containers were and stayed empty). The wait staff were neither attentive nor forthcoming and displayed a somewhat superior attitude. After two similar experiences, I decided to have breakfast elsewhere, especially since the buffet offers a disappointingly small selection of items (not even regular cereals).

Beautiful hotel with excellent service. Boutique hotel in an otherwise busy area of NYC. Fabulous staff make it even more special. Rooms are super cozy and unique. Food was great too. All around a great place to stay in NYC>.

I really like this company, the hotel is lovely and the staff was really nice with us! We also had some cocktails there at the bar is like the hotels they have in London! It’s really close to the 5th Avenue

First time stay. Impressed by the art and style of the building. Welcoming staff with an efficient check-in. Room decor and use of space was impressive. Room faced 57th St and I could here no noise! Great window insulation! A/C in the room was amazing — lowered the temp to 58 deg while there was a heat advisory outside (apologies to the power grid). The mattress was incredible — best night of sleep in a hotel. Room service was on time and the food very good. The bar and afternoon tea were enjoyable.  Side note: My only non-recommendation is if you ask the staff where to eat, disregard the Italian place next door. MUCH better options also within walking distance in Midtown. But they all seem to love it.

Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I can't say enough great things about this hotel. We have stayed here a few times and each time the staff is fantastic, the food is AMAZING, the rooms are big for NYC. It's also super clean, I am a germ freak. And for a sophisticated hotel it is very homey too! We love their sister hotel in London, the Covent Garden and decided to try this hotel. I will always stay here now. It's close to all of the major shopping and great restaurants. What I love the most is that for such a great hotel the people working there are genuinely kind and thoughtful. Stay here - it's worth it and price-wise better I find than anyone else in their class.

Went on a girls trip last November and had the most wonderful time at the Whitby. The hotel is beautiful and the staff was very warm and professional. The rooms were spacious (for NY standards) and beautifully decorated. Everything felt new and fresh. The bar and restaurant was fantastic. Just a gorgeous space! The perfect place for a martini as well as brunch. Can't wait to return and show it to my husband.

Stayed there for 2 nights last week and I am ready to return! The service was impeccable- everyone was available to offer suggestions, help you out in any way. The Kit Kemp designed spaces made you feel as if you were someone's house guest saying in New York versus a hotel. LOVED IT!

I stayed 2 nights for business in the Whitby. Great location. Great rooms. Great bathrooms/shower. Very clean. Super well insulated windows hence not the usual “its too loud NYC madness” Great Gym. Great concierge service. I will come back for sure. Very recommendable

booked the hotel based on reviews. Never stayed in this hotel before but it's fabulous. New York hotels are hit and miss. This was a bullseye and the people are so courteous and welcoming. The rooms are very well maintained and clean. The rooms are also very quiet. I would come to this hotel again.

This hotel has it all! Charming decor, truly helpful staff, fabulous bar, lovely courtyard for breakfast or tea and the most incredible location. I almost don’t want to tell people about because I want to keep it a secret. It’s that special.

I usually stay at the Nomad in Flatiron. Business required that I stay uptown and the Whitby is a friendly, stylish choice. The staff are amazing. The location perfect if you need to be uptown. The food and ambiance are top notch. My room, while in the back of the hotel and looking across an alley at a wall, was large for New York, perfectly appointed and super comfortable. The bed and linens were conducive to a great night’s sleep. I met colleagues both for breakfast and cocktails and the food and service matched the stylish nature of the hotel. I will absolutely return and can recommend it to the most discriminating traveler.

I have stayed at the Whitby before and LOVED it so this time my friend and i decided to visit and treat ourselves to afternoon tea. How splendid it was! This hotel has got it going on. The food was first class (they now offer a healthy afternoon tea as well as traditional), the staff were attentive and friendly and the ambience, wonderful. I made the foolish mistake of staying elsewhere this visit but I won’t be repeating that mistake again, this is one of the most comfortable, unpretentious and impressive hotels in all of Manhattan. Highly recommend!

Just a few steps from Central Park, 5th Ave, Columbus Circle, this hotel is super well located but stay low profile. However, if you spend time to experience all the details here, you will find everything is well presented and balanced. The room is nice, the service is top class, breakfast is just right to start the day. I will be very happy to stay here again next time I am back to NYC.

Why stay in an English hotel in NY, you may ask? Well, we tried a new bustling hotel and just felt at odds so quickly changed to the classic yet quirky Whitby, and am glad we did.Charming and spacious rooms with glorious full-height windows offering up NYC views for all with jet-lag to gorge on. The quirky design is a strong feature throughout the hotel which makes for a special feel, English and yet with a strong NY feel.Service, food and bar scene where all excellent, particularly the service. A regrettable incident was handled with professional aplomb and courtesy turning what could have been messy into an opportunity to excel. Our new home-from-home when visiting the wonderful NYC

For years I have been trying to find MY place to stay in NYC. I have tried the big high end like the Plaza, Piette, and St Regis as well as more budget friendly like the Palace, NYLO and even the NYAC and all of the were missing something. So after having been introduced to an loving the Covent Garden hotel in London I thought I would try its sister hotel in New York and I was not disappointed. The hotel has character, and great service with comfortable well decorated rooms. In fact this is one of those reviews I hesitated to write as I don't want the hotel to be sold out the next time I need to book it.

great hotel, wonderful location, incredible staff. floor to ceiling windows, skyline view, bed comfortable, bathroom/shower large . Room decor is lovely. the hotel was part of a live auction trip we bid on, usually don't stay at hotels of this caliber, so it was a very special treat...something i could get used to!

review_body: I spent ten nights at the Whitby very recently, and while my work brought with it long hours and high stress, I could not have wished for a better place to be a guest at during this time.There are, of course, the cool design, the hip-and-happening bar with great drinks and good food, the nicely decorated, spacious and immaculately-kept rooms, soft and comfy bets, ... and proper bathrooms - none of which are a given in New York. There is all that. Yet, as my subsequent stay at the Crosby Street Hotel (same company) showed, all that counts for little without the staff that can make the place feel special ... because they make you feel special.As a frequent hotel guest it is all too easy to forget that staff are people, but if you don’t .... well, then you might find that they bend over backwards for you because they care about how you feel in their place. You may not notice it immediately, but you do over time, and you do when it is not there.Hospitality at the Whitby is taken seriously, from the time you arrive and Kevin checks you in with that barely suppressed broad grin that seems to hide a giddy enthusiasm for meeting people, to the time you have to leave and Ivan sprints around the block to get you a cab quickly.In between, Katie welcomes you cheerfully at 7am for breakfast when your body clock tells you it’s 2am, and then picks you up and gets you going. Fatou, will serve you with efficient professionalism, accompanied by a warm smile ... and she will know, within a day, what you want to order before you do.If you come for drinks or dinner, you will meet interesting guests and locals at the bar, where Nicky knows that an Amaretto Sour is best served “up”, and deftly directs the traffic at the counter when she’s not busy with one of her wondrous libations. Boys and girls will get distracted when Keshia serves cocktails and sets hearts aflutter with her shy smile.In amongst the busy activity of an evening’s full house or Sunday brunch, you will find Sydney, who seems to have hospitality in her blood ... and in her soul. She makes sure that everyone is looked after, and she will make you feel as though you are an old friend, whom she has the privilege to welcome in her own home. Things at the Whitby happen around you, they just work in the way they should ... and in the rare instance that they don’t, they get fixed immediately and graciously. Sadly, such hospitality is a rare thing these days - it’s engagement that is not obsequious, it is attention that is discreet yet constant, it is the little things that people don’t have to do, but do because they evidently care about you not as a customer, but as a guest in their home. Well done everyone, your passion and commitment shows, and it is the reason why this is such a special place!

If you are a Firmadale's fan, you will love this property for sure! The decor, the service, the location, the smell - well, pretty much everything - is perfect!A balcony to make you feel home, enough space at the room and the special cozy touch makes even harder to want to leave the room :)

review_body: Whitby Bar Afternoon Tea was delicious. They offer a gluten/vegan tea as well. Staff was attentive and we didn't feel rushed. My companion left something behind and the concierge mailed it to her at no charge.

The Whitby was everything that I hoped it would be. I the rooms were a good size, very comfortable, and exceptionally clean and well appointed.The bar and public spaces were also beautifully maintained and were great to spend time in. The staff were all incredibly helpful, well trained and polite giving exceptional service throughout my stay. The cocktails in the bar were creative and also brilliantly made, with the Jazz on Friday night a really nice touch. The location is also great being near Central Park and the Subway between 5th and 6th Avenues. It was a perfect hotel experience.

We have stayed here twice, and for us, they are just missing the mark. I really want to love it as a midtown location but it’s not my first choice. We’ve spent lots of time at Crosby Street (NY) and Hamyard (London) and those are two of our favorite hotels. The decor here is not as striking although it does have similar or same wood flooring, lighting, and some great quirky art. However, the rooms facing the street are loud, the light comes around the shades and blackout drapes, and staff have a bit more attitude here than at other locations. Attached is a photo of room service delivery (with the automatic 20% added) If you have meetings to conduct, though, their meeting rooms are great and very private, and well serviced. The hotel is definitely a solid 4 — just not quite up to par with their London properties and Crosby Street.

The Whitby delivered on the high expectations we arrived with. An almost artistic experience. World class staff. Great honor Bar. Fully priced but worth every penny. I have stayed at several Firmdale Hotels in my travels-Kit Kemp’s interiors are unique and inspiring. Great mid-town location. Great shower-great room service meal.

Enjoyed a fabulous two nights here. Refreshingly different, exciting interiors, impeccable, friendly service and the best tea in New York. The bar is great, the orangerie is perfect for a relaxed dinner and the honesty bar for guests is a really nice touch.

We were in New York for my mother’s 60th birthday. We booked at this hotel because it’s part of the Firmdale hotel group and we love the hotels. We went to London once. The room was fabulous. We loved the decor. Every detail thought of. Eye candy. The food in the Whitby bar was delicious and the staff very friendly and professional.The concierges helped us out with a lot too. I want to thank some staff members: Katy from the whitby bar, Holly also from the bar, Fatou from the bar, West the doorman and Ivan the concierge. The next time we come to New York we definitely come back to the hotel.

I've stayed at The Whitby a handful of times and it never disappoints. While the location is central to many of Midtown's attractions, the hotel still manages to feel like an oasis: surprisingly quiet and serene, beautifully decorated with eclectic art and furnishings, and detailed with luxurious touches like fresh flowers and the most delicious smelling toiletries (the floor to ceiling windows and basin tubs are also to die for!) The customer service is top notch with a super friendly and accommodating front desk staff and room service that always manages to deliver meals with incredible speed (and yes, the food is fresh and tasty.) The gym is another plus— well-equipped and usually empty so it often feels like a private studio (score!) This hotel is one of my favorite hotels in the city and by far the best in Midtown. I couldn’t recommend The Whitby enough and can’t wait for my next stay. :)

New York City, New York

review_body: My wife and I visited NYC last month for our anniversary. We decided to branch out from the larger luxury chain hotels- Ritz Carlton, Waldorf etc... After stumbling upon the Whitby we were impressed with the reviews and pictures so we decided to give it a shot. From the second we confirmed the reservation we were more than impressed. This is by far the best hotel experience we have ever had. The hotel is immaculate. They did an incredible design job down to every little detail imaginable. The staff was extremely professional and helpful. The location is perfect walking distance from Central Park, Time Square and other great spots. The Whitby experience has changed our hotel expectations from here on out. Bye bye chain hotels and hello boutique. If only they had a Whitby ever where we travel!

This is our 3rd stay at a Firmdale hotel. We first discovered Firmdale when we stayed at the Soho Hotel in London in 2010. We very much like their hotels because their design makes guests feel very much at home and their service is always very personable. The Whitby does not disappoint! It is a brand new hotel less than a year old. We stayed there in connecting luxury rooms for 5 nights. It was a wonderful home away from home. Each time we'd come and go, we would be greeted by staff at the reception, concierge and doorman. Previous 2 visits to New York we had stayed at the Four Seasons but it is larger hotel so you always feel like a stranger. The Whitby was a huge difference if you are looking for a much more cosy and comfortable stay. Room - every room has unique furnishing and that's the best part about the Whitby. Getting back into the room after a day out is always a welcome relief. The bathroom is large with dual basins and a bidet like all other Firmdale hotels. The large windows are great as light gets into the room even if you are on the lower floors. I think what's missing in all Firmdale hotels is the coffee/tea in the room. There were chocolates and cookies every day in our room which is a fantastic touch. The walk in shower is also amazing but only suites have baths at the Whitby.Restaurant/Bar - beautiful orangery adjacent to the main part of the restaurant. It features illuminated porcelain pots with various NY landmarks etched onto them. The Whitby breakfast with buffet was very good and coffee is excellent (not the usual American coffee)Gym - very well equipped and big for a hotel of this size. Location - the hotel is very well located in upper midtown. Walking distance to Times Square, 5th Ave, Central Park .. if we needed to go anywhere farther, we would get an Uber or taxi. When coming from the airport, our taxi driver dropped us off on 5th Ave at corner of W 56th, but you can insist they drop you off in front of the hotel because they just have to drive down W 55th then loop back to W 56th. The hotel is close to all kinds of restaurants and on W 56th there are many small eateries. There is also a Bread & Butter opposite the hotel. We can't wait to go back to New York to the Whitby. We might try the Crosby Street hotel so it will be a difficult decision!

A better place to stay at in New York is hard to find. Was a pure pleasure. The staff was always present and very helpful. Good location made it easy to get around too. It all comes with a good seized price tag, but it’s totally worth every penny!

Wow! This place is just the best. The decor is like nothing I've ever seen, with bold choices and quirky details throughout, it impresses as soon as you go through the door. I loved the baskets above the bar (random!), and the vases set in the restaurant wall decorated with the New York landmarks. The food was all top quality, and the service impeccable. In the room, the bed was huge, the bathroom really well finished and the tv huge. The best part though was the soft padding and luxurious material covering all the walls. It muffled the sound in the room, killing the sounds from outside - it really helped me sleep.Outside, the hotel is right next to all the designer shops, and its really close to central park - shame it was winter.All in all a very special hotel, and a big thanks to Nick and the team for making it a wonderful visit to NYC!

My mom is a huge Downton Abbey fan, I saw ads for the exhibition. Then looking on their website. I stumbled across the Downton Abbey afternoon tea. It did include VIP tickets to the exhibition. The service, the menu and the tea was delicious. We had the English Breakfast blend. It was your English tea with finger sandwiches, scones, and mini desserts. We had the best time. The decor was beautiful chandeliers made from recycled bottles, the ones in the main room had birds. The artwork had Moroccan motifs and had the world traveler feel.. They had a wonderful antique plate collection hung in cases all over the dining area. In the bathroom(very clean) decor had Campbell soup cans and fish wallpaper. You don't realize that the small bites can be quite filling. they even let my mom take home the leftover scones.If you want to do mom and daughter day, lunch with the girls do the afternoon tea.They have it all the time. Would I do this again. Yes

Recommended by a great friend/travel agentwas a great little boutique hotel..Christmas cozy! Rooms were warm and comfy, the staff was excellent. The bell hop(wish i remembered his name) was outstanding and informative! excellent location for walking...cant wait to try another hotel in this family

My wife and I spent the weekend at the Whitby. Great, modern decor. Cheery and welcoming guest room. Very imaginative and joyful. But best of all was the friendly staff. Without exception, they were helpful as could be without being intrusive. A lively and welcoming bar. Bravo. We’ll be back soon.

review_body: The newly opened Whitby Hotel is beautiful and the afternoon tea offered is delightful! Hotel décor is stately, yet modern with bright and pleasing colors. The tea room is beautifully appointed and offers a level of quiet intimacy few restaurants offer. Look up so as not to miss the incredible chandeliers. And how clever to decorate the walls with vintage platters! I had the special Downton Abbey inspired tea, but I am certain any tea offering would be delicious and served with the same graciousness. Staff was wonderful! If afternoon tea is any indication of level of hospitality and attention, a stay at the Whitby Hotel would be exceptional.

At this moment in time, this is the best hotel in NYC. Service, rooms and just about everything else is second to none. The Whitby is a tasteful mix of unintrusive service and luxury accommodation in the heart of the city.

LOVED the hotel, design, touches, honesty bar, breakfast, sterling silver, china, bathroom and cleanliness. It was really a nice hotel. The Bed was comfortable!I love that it was small and cozy, but not worn-down and dated, as so many "4 star" hotels are in the city. EVERY staff member that we encountered was helpful and had great English manners, without being stuffy and uptight. It was refreshing!I would stay here again and would highly recommend it.. but I have to point out two things that were annoying....the bathroom door was so big and really got in the way.design FLAW. should be a pocket door!56th street dumps into Trump Tower and so the traffic is a nightmare trying to get a cab or get dropped off. it's best to walk from 6th street.

Belated review...stayed here in early October for an overnight celebration. Booked online and noted that it was a big annivsersary and that we are long-time guests at Firmdale's Number Sixteen in London. What a surprise to be offered an upgrade to a junior suite and a knock on the door shortly after arriving with cupcakes and a Happy Anniversary note. Rooms - as expexted at fabulous Firmdale properties - were beautiful. All the more so since this is such a new hotel. Lighting, art, fabrics, atmosphere all beautiful and comfortable - same with bathroom and their signature toiletries. Drink at the bar after dinner downtown was lovely - as was breakfast in the airy restaurant in the mroning - gym was decent size and fresh/clean. Slept soundly and loved being a guest here. Service/front desk/concierge all top-notch - professional, welcoming, friendly. Firmdale has that magic touch and Kit Kemp's interior design is original, uplifting, colorful and comfortable. Looking foward to our next stay and will recommend for a stay, drink, tea, lunch, dinner, etc.

It can be delightful to stay at a brand new hotel. The design is fresh and popping, everything functions and everything is clean. The staff are still energetic and genuinely friendly and not yet worn down. The beds are bouncy and the linens smell heavenly. The public areas are well curated with an intriguing array of art, including the grandfather clock you absolutely must spend time with. Many of the touches will look familiar, however, including the chairs in the restaurant and the light fixtures, if you are familiar with the rest of the Kit "Kempire". The floor to ceiling and wall to wall windows are superb, although I looked out at a brick wall. The thing I liked the most is that the staff are very clearly encouraged to be themselves. I enjoyed the staff personality and the resultant more personalized guest experience. It is so easy for these hotels to feel like "anywhere" but this one doesn't. There is a fitness room in the basement featuring Woodway treadmills, Technogym steppers and cross trainers, each with up to date computerized screens. There are a couple of benches, a dual adjustable pulley station and dumbbells going up to a respectable 100 lbs.

We visited New York City to check out the sights and sounds of the Christmas Season; and decided to stay at the Whitby rather that our usual hotel, The Lowell.The Whitby is actually an wonderful design gallery, that also happens to be a hotel. The venues are dominated by color....and the objects, fabrics, artwork and wall coverings all catch your attention. It's not a place for the visually illiterate. It is a place for discovery and uses of all your senses.We stayed two (2) evenings in a suite that was extremely well appointed. Thumbs Up for the forceful shower; but Thumbs Down for the lighting in the living room area. Also, the service for breakfast was agonizingly slow.

Just, wow. The hotel is centrally located in a great shopping area and just a couple blocks away from bike rentals and central park. The design of the hotel is very typically Firmdale which is upscale, comfortable, and whimsical. Every detail is considered.The beds are super comfortable. The lighting is well designed. The breakfast is good but the service is a bit lacking in the bar/restaurant. That was the only small irritation of the stay. We stayed in a suite which faced the street but was still very quiet and comfortable. Not super large rooms, but every amenity is considered. Would definitely stay again. Also, I am now addicted to their linen spray and need to buy more for my own home.

Kit Kemp does it again with her innovative quirky cool Whitby Hotel. The attention to detail mesmerises all the senses- from the collection of artwork to the wallpaper and fabrics used. The hotel is strictly adherent to the Firmdale quality one would expect- beds comfy, pillows luxurious , bathrooms clean and well appointed with an insane shower head!! As always the quality finishes song- the furniture and the appointment of familiar experienced staff from the Crosby hotel, Tod in concierge- was a stand out! The food as always for breakfast is superb, amazing value for money!! We will definitely be back, we feel at home in this comfy, gorgeous hotel. Thanks for having us!!

Fantastic breakfast place , quite , elegant great atmosphere The eggs Benedict was amazing , service was fabulous The new place to have a delicious quite pleasant breakfast The staff really go out of the way to provide fantastic service

Beautiful hotel that makes you feel like you're at home. The rooms are exquisite and the whole staff was super friendly and helpful. My favorite part of the hotel was the beautiful, vibrant colors in the decor. And the clock in the lobby. You have to see it! The location can't be beat; you can walk everywhere. Would highly recommend a stay at The Whitby and can't wait to go back again.

So sorry has taken me this long to review my amazing stay. Was in NYC for a physician visit for my 17 year old son. We have to visit a few times a year and have stayed at some amazing places and this is now one of our favorites. Place has beautiful yet whimsical designs. Room was immaculate, every request met from cheerful staff and food at the restaurant Fantastic! Room service on time, delicious and servings quite large. The Honors bar for guests only nice place to hang away from the restaurant bar. Also, some fun celebrity spotting around the property. Looking forward to our next stay.

Thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Whitby. We have enjoyed many NYC hotels and this surpassed them all. The rooms are super comfortable, the decor quirky and chic couple this with great food and friendly, helpful staff, you really don’t need much more in NY. We would have welcomed an orientation of the hotel upon check-in but other than that 5 stars.

Elegant modern design with exceptional service with emphasis on the details. There is not a cut corner in sight. Easily the best hotel I've stayed in NY.  There is nowhere else you should be staying in midtown. Looking forward to my next stay!

Came with my brother and the front desk staff all the way through the wait staff were top notch. This property is run very, very well. I'll be staying here again for my next trip to New York City. Comfortable bed, beautiful bathroom, fantastic bar and restaurant downstairs.

I spent a long weekend recently in a lovely room on the 5th floor of the new Whitby Hotel. I have stayed at several other Firmdale Hotels and, like them, The Whitby gives painstaking attention to ensuring that its guests are comfortably delighted at every turn. The wee floor lights that twinkle as the elevator doors open, the whimsical but carefully curated artwork in the public areas, the elegant but fun colours and fabrics of the rooms and the fact that everything works add up to an experience that justifies the price. Delicious breakfasts in the morning and cocktails with bar snacks were prepared and presented in the pretty and swank bar area or the gorgeous conservatory with friendly professionalism. Service was swift and low-key...umbrellas offered when the rains came, an extra night’s accommodation in the same room due to a weather-induced flight cancellation organized with an unasked-for extension of the weekend rate without missing a beat. Although I love Firmdale’s The Crosby for its unsurpassed Soho location, The Whitby is a great choice for anyone who wants to be within easy reach of Broadway, Fifth Avenue and Central Park. This makes it, in my book, the #1 choice for a first-time visitor to New York City who wants to be in a quiet location but close to the action. Oh, and it’s just across the street from Momofuku!

Stayed here at the end of October. Great rooms with fabulous furnishings. Full height windows in the room and great toiletries in the bathroom. Very comfortable and small boutique hotel. Perfect place to stay and unwind after a day in the City. Service at times was a bit slow in the bar and restaurant but doesn’t take away from the overall experience. All stay were very helpful

FANTASTIC! Wonderful service. Very chic rooms with soundproof floor to ceiling windows. Amazing public spacesThe bathroom was huge with two sinks and flat screen over the tub. The interior design was gorgeous - very British and fun. High ceilings and windows that open on the diagonal. Fabulous breakfast in beautiful dining room. Great location

I was staying as part of a business trip - solo business traveller. This hotel is terrific - very well designed, incredible location, rooms spacious, great gym, nice bar, friendly staff, a great stay. Only things to improve: price of meals - silly expensive, esp breakfast. Place across the road does same food (ok a little worse) for 1/5th the price. The concierge hid behind his Mac. I asked him where to get a good coffee and he googled it. Really? Otherwise, well worth it, would return.

I'll begin with the restaurant, the decor is warm, bright and absolutely lovely. The menu is interesting , and our lunches quite delicious. They have a room called the library with wall to wall books and the most charming decor. I checked out a couple of their rooms. While on the smallish side, they are decorated with the use of color and wimsy. All in all, I love it!

My visits to New York usually occur once or twice a month. My go to place is the Whitby on 56th Street. Genuine caring staff and very comfortable beds with top quality Lefroy Brooks plumbing fixtures. Great restaurant for breakfast in the hotel and wonderful restaurants in the surrounding areas. Whitby is always a go to hotel.

I was very excited to try this hotel as we love Hamyard in London. It was perfect. Very chic decor but warm and fun. Staff bends over backwards to help you with any matter. Rooms are spacious and bathroom fantastic. Shower is amazing. Great water pressure and clean! Bar is cool and fun. The rikrak toiletries will make you crave the product when you get home. Just buy some before you leave. This hotel group knows service. We had some issue with breakfast in restaurant waitress as she was agonizing slow to bring coffee but hotel mgr on duty made up for it. I can’t wait to go back.

This is the first time I have stayed in a Firmdale hotel outside the UK and boy was it a treat. It has been beautifully decorated, contemporary art to the fore. A wonderful juxtaposition of traditional classics, particularly the UK country house styled bathrooms that I guess were sourced from CP Hart, and contemporary best. My stay was far too short but I was there long enough to confirm that its highest standards are echoed in its restaurant. All the staff were very professional and willing to help, with anything. Can't wait to return!

If you have never stayed at a Firmdale Hotel, you are in for a treat. They are cool boutique hotels that never sacrifice comfort, luxury, beauty and service in their hipness.We actually live in NYC but every once in awhile we need the magic and romance of a fabulous hotel. Having spent Christmas and some other occasions at the Firmdale’s other NYC property, The Crosby Street Hotel, and loved it, we were keen to try the new midtown Whitby which we did on my birthday weekend in July. Work kept us in the country for my birthday this year, and since it is so near the 4th of July local travel just wouldn’t do.We opted for the Whitby where the gracious GM, Kathrin Apitz, upgraded us to a fabulous suite with a terrace. I was gifted with champagne and delicious treats and some great Kit Kemp (Firmdale’s founder) products for face and body and her famous room and linen spray that makes you just want to shove your face into your pillow and risk smothering.The people who work at the Whitby are smilers but not in that obnoxious “I will be your server” kind of way. They are actually interested in making you happy and so you are ,and so everybody is happy! What a concept! As an organizational psychologist I can attest that Firmdale is on to something with their training. From Stuart, the charming Scottish restaurant manager, to Robert at the desk, and Fatou, the best waitress anywhere, anytime, you will be well taken care of. As I write this, I know I will have more trouble finding a room at the Whitby now, and probably will never get another upgrade because other people are also discovering the Whitby’s charms (and celebs love it – recent citings include Anne Hathaway and Judi Dench), I still have to share because it is the right thing to do. PS Had lunch at the Whitby yesterday after being away all the rest of the summer and it was like I had never left. Fatou greeted me with a warm “Welcome back!” and I sat smiling sniffing the air.

review_body: Our first time at the Whitby, and it won't be our last! We love the location, the room, the staff, the service. We have stayed at The Crosby Street Hotel years ago and loved it too. I highly recommend it if you are looking for a great location on the West side.

Had an absolutely wonderful stay here. Pure luxury with incredible attention to detail and attentive friendly staff to match. Very well located near Central Park, the Guggenheim and MOMA. Cant recommend the Whitby enough. My first time in NYC and it certainly won't be my last. Thanks to the whole team for making my stay so enjoyable. See you very soon I hope!!

Elegant luxury, extreme comfort palpable in every corner of the hotel, an amazing experience, enjoyable, productive for business in a wonderful, warm cosy atmosphere. Highly recommend and will go back

Thank-you so much for helping make my most recent NYC trip so memorable. I couldn't have asked for better accommodations. The door men and front desk were so kind and welcoming everyday. The decor of my room was stunning. I made it a point to enjoy my room for an evening soaking in the tub, and relaxing on the terrace. I can't wait to return to this hotel for my next visit to NYC. Btw....best hair dryer ever! I've ordered myself one :) Sanela Krcic, thank you for your warm welcoming and hospitality!

Travelers should know that The Whitby is a stones throw from Trump Tower. This means the road is completely closed to traffic at random and the staff will refuse to help you with luggage. Why? New York City does not require employees to tell you what is happening outside of their four, compressed walls. There are 24 hour a day protests (noisy) and a heavy Secret Service presence. Thinking that was the worst of it, it was not. We booked the room for six nights and after disregarding the barrier, driving up on a sidewalk to get in and taking luggage out of the car ourselves, we were greeted by a staff that was badly trained and unhelpful. They seemed dazed, confused, and put us in a room that had construction going on above us. We left within 16 hours.The management IS NOT indicative of the Firmdale Hotel group, nor of the dozens of top notch hotels in New York. The Crosby Street Hotel - their sister property - is exceptional. This is a location AND a management problem.

Artwork on the walls and full of charm. Our stay at this enchanting new hotel near MOMA was the highlight of our trip. When a staff member learned it was my birthday he couldn't have done more to make it special. Bright, cheerful room, floor to ceiling windows. Double curtains worked well at night. I usually don't sleep well while traveling but no problem here. A special soaking tub I never wanted to leave. Don't miss afternoon tea (there's a healthy version) or a film in the private theater downstairs. I could go on. Loved it. Highly, highly recommended.

Great service. Gorgeous interior. Thoughtful staff. How did I not find this place sooner? It's right by 5th avenue so you're near Central Park, shopping, MoMA, etc. I can recommend the restaurant too.
